duties_responsibilities.duty: Develop and execute a comprehensive product strategy for back office systems, aligning with the company's overall goals and objectives.
Collaborate with internal stakeholders to understand their needs and gather requirements for back office system enhancements.
Work closely with cross-functional teams to drive the end-to-end product development lifecycle, ensuring timely and high-quality delivery of features and enhancements.
Communicate the product vision, roadmap, and project updates to internal stakeholders, including executive leadership, department heads, and end-users.
Utilize data analytics and user insights to make informed product decisions, prioritize features, and measure the success of implemented enhancements.
Stay updated with industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in back office systems, bringing innovative ideas and insights to the product team.
Ensure that the back office systems comply with relevant regulations, data privacy requirements, and security standards.

education_certification.credential: Minimum of 5 years of experience in product management, preferably in the development of back office systems or enterprise software solutions. Strong technical understanding and the ability to collaborate effectively with engineering teams to drive the development of complex software products. Ability to think strategically, analyze market dynamics, identify opportunities, and make data-driven product decisions. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams, executive stakeholders, and end-users. Demonstrated ability to lead and influence teams without direct authority, driving consensus and delivering results in a fast-paced environment. Proficiency in project management techniques and tools to ensure effective planning, coordination, and execution of product initiatives. Passion for understanding user needs, empathy for end-users, and a commitment to delivering exceptional user experiences. A master's degree in business administration, computer science, or a related field would be an advantage.
